result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont T McNealey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lamont T McNealey in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
1 year Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 41 days).  To be served in Waukesha County only. 
Term of Probation: 2 Years may be transferred to Milwaukee County. 
Early release after 18 months if restitutuion and costs are paid in full.  
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Innovation Custom Doors and First Bank Financial Center. 
Maintain employment. 
Condition Time: 30 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
Restitution: $2369.05 to be paid to First Bank Financial Center as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $278.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lamont T McNealey in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Date remains as previously scheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lamont T McNealey in court, in custody, with attorney with Anna Kees for Adam J. Schleis.    District Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
